info.name: Route Mobile WhatsApp Business Messaging API

request.description:
## API details:   This API is used to Broadcast WhatsApp pre-approved Messages( templates) to end user   ## API Request Details   |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|-----------------------|-------------------------| |`phone`|Mandatory|end user phone number with country code and +| |`type`|Mandatory|API type| |`template_name`|Mandatory|Name of template approved with WhatsApp| |`lang_code`|Mandatory|language in which template is approved| |`header`|Optional|Add only for multimedia template| |`body`|Optional|Add only if you have variables in the template| |`button`|Optional|Add only if you have dynamic URL redirection button in the template| |`extra`|Optional|Add only if you wish to pass any extra value in API and the same will be recieved in delivery reports|   ## `header` Field Breakdown:   header is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the text or multimedia based header section of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only if you have template with text in the header|"header":[{"text":"{variable}"}]| |`link`|Mandatory|Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample image url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]| |`image`|Mandatory|Add only if you have image template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample image url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension( you tube URL will not work)}"}}]| |`document`|Mandatory|Add only if you have document template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample document url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]| |`video`|Mandatory|Add only if you have video template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample video url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]|   ## `body` Field Breakdown:   body is a JSON string consisting of a text key that defines the variables of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add if you have variable in the template|"body":[{"text":"{variable}"}]| |`text,text`|Mandatory|Add if you have multiple variable in the template|"body":[{"text":"{variable}"},{"text":"{variable}"}]| ## `button` Field Breakdown:   button is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the dynamic variable pf the call to action url redirection button of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`button_no`|Mandatory|Add only if you have dynamic url redirection button in the template, button_no key specified the position of dynamic url|"button":[{"button_no":"0/1","url":"{dynamic_url variable}"}]| |`url`|Mandatory|Add only if you have dynamic url redirection button in the template, url key specifies the variable part of dynamic url redirection button|"button":[{"button_no":"0/1","url":"{dynamic_url variable}"}]| ## Success Response Structure: For every success request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and request_id.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Response Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|---------------|--------| |processing|message received successfully|Valid payload structure with unique request_id per request|202|{"message":"message received successfully","status":"processing","request_id":"794c3fd4-f142-11eb-8e02-0242ac120005"}​​​​|   ## Failed Response Structure: For every failed request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and reason.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Reason*|*Error Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|--------|---------------|--------| |failed|unable to process request|Incorrect Authorization token|Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent|202|{"message":"unable to process request","status":"failed","reason":"Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent"}| |-|The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.|Incorrect url|-|404|{"message": "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."}| |-|The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand.|Incorrect payload structure|-|400|{"message":"The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand."}| |failure|Please check API docs|Mandatory key is missing|unable to verify payload type|400|{"message":"Please check API docs","status":"failure","reason":"unable to verify payload type"}|   > *Note* : * TPS around 100 provided multi-threading is implemented and utilize keepalive connections option in HTTP Client to minimize SSL overhead and latency. * Templates are triggered to users who are out of 24 hour window.

## API details:   This API is used to Broadcast WhatsApp pre-approved Messages( templates) to end user   ## API Request Details   |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|-----------------------|-------------------------| |`phone`|Mandatory|end user phone number with country code and +| |`type`|Mandatory|API type| |`template_name`|Mandatory|Name of template approved with WhatsApp| |`lang_code`|Mandatory|language in which template is approved| |`header`|Optional|Add only for multimedia template| |`body`|Optional|Add only if you have variables in the template| |`button`|Optional|Add only if you have dynamic URL redirection button in the template| |`extra`|Optional|Add only if you wish to pass any extra value in API and the same will be recieved in delivery reports|   ## `header` Field Breakdown:   header is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the text or multimedia based header section of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only if you have template with text in the header|"header":[{"text":"{variable}"}]| |`link`|Mandatory|Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample image url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]| |`image`|Mandatory|Add only if you have image template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample image url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension( you tube URL will not work)}"}}]| |`document`|Mandatory|Add only if you have document template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample document url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]| |`video`|Mandatory|Add only if you have video template|"header":[{"image":{"link":"{sample video url hosted publicly starting with https:// and ending with file extension}"}}]|   ## `body` Field Breakdown:   body is a JSON string consisting of a text key that defines the variables of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add if you have variable in the template|"body":[{"text":"{variable}"}]| |`text,text`|Mandatory|Add if you have multiple variable in the template|"body":[{"text":"{variable}"},{"text":"{variable}"}]| ## `button` Field Breakdown:   button is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the dynamic variable pf the call to action url redirection button of a template:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*|*Sample*| |-----|--------------------|-------------|--------| |`button_no`|Mandatory|Add only if you have dynamic url redirection button in the template, button_no key specified the position of dynamic url|"button":[{"button_no":"0/1","url":"{dynamic_url variable}"}]| |`url`|Mandatory|Add only if you have dynamic url redirection button in the template, url key specifies the variable part of dynamic url redirection button|"button":[{"button_no":"0/1","url":"{dynamic_url variable}"}]| ## Success Response Structure: For every success request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and request_id.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Response Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|---------------|--------| |processing|message received successfully|Valid payload structure with unique request_id per request|202|{"message":"message received successfully","status":"processing","request_id":"794c3fd4-f142-11eb-8e02-0242ac120005"}​​​​|   ## Failed Response Structure: For every failed request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and reason.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Reason*|*Error Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|--------|---------------|--------| |failed|unable to process request|Incorrect Authorization token|Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent|202|{"message":"unable to process request","status":"failed","reason":"Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent"}| |-|The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.|Incorrect url|-|404|{"message": "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."}| |-|The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand.|Incorrect payload structure|-|400|{"message":"The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand."}| |failure|Please check API docs|Mandatory key is missing|unable to verify payload type|400|{"message":"Please check API docs","status":"failure","reason":"unable to verify payload type"}|   > *Note* : * TPS around 100 provided multi-threading is implemented and utilize keepalive connections option in HTTP Client to minimize SSL overhead and latency. * Templates are triggered to users who are out of 24 hour window.

## API details:   This API is used to trigger WhatsApp response to user initiated messages within 24 hour window.   ## API Request Details   |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|-----------------------|-------------------------| |`phone`|Mandatory|end user phone number with country code and +| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only for text response| |`peview_url`|Mandatory|Add only if you wish to see thumbnail of url added in text response| |`media`|Mandatory|Add only for multimedia response| |`extra`|Optional|Add only if you wish to pass any extra value in API and the same will be recieved in delivery reports|   ## `media` Field Breakdown:   media is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the multimedia or button sections of a session response:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`type`|Mandatory|Defines the multimedia shared| |`url`|Mandatory|Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia message| |`file`|Mandatory|Filename of the multimedia to be triggered| |`caption`|Mandatory|Text shared along with multimedia. Though it's mandatory still will not reflect for Audio| |`latitude`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`longitude`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`name`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`address`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`header`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message. This defines the text or multimedia shared in the button| |`body`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message. Defines the text descption at the top of the button options| |`footer_text`|Optional|Add only if you are sending button in session message. Add only if you want to show footer in button option| |`button`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message|   ## `header` Field Breakdown:   header is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the button based header section of a session response:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending text in the header| |`type`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the button triggered| |`url`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia message| |`file`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the filename of the multimedia to be triggered| |`caption`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the text shared along with multimedia. Though it's mandatory still will not reflect for Audio| ## `body` Field Breakdown:   body is a JSON string consisting of a text that defines the button options in session message:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`body`|Mandatory|Defines the text descption at the top of the button options| ## `button` Field Breakdown:   button is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys of the button options in session message:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`id`|Mandatory|Defines the position of the button| |`title`|Mandatory|Defines the button label. Max 20 charaters| |`description`|Optional|Add only if you want to describe more in regards to the interactive menu list button| |`section_title`|Mandatory|Add only if you have interactive menu list button. Describes the main list of the button| ## Success Response Structure: For every success request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and request_id.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Response Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|---------------|--------| |processing|message received successfully|Valid payload structure with unique request_id per request|202|{"message":"message received successfully","status":"processing","request_id":"794c3fd4-f142-11eb-8e02-0242ac120005"}​​​​|   ## Failed Response Structure: For every failed request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and reason.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Reason*|*Error Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|--------|---------------|--------| |failed|unable to process request|Incorrect Authorization token|Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent|401|{"message":"unable to process request","status":"failed","reason":"Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent"}| |-|The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.|Incorrect url|-|404|{"message": "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."}| |-|The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand.|Incorrect payload structure|-|400|{"message":"The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand."}| |failure|Please check API docs|Mandatory key is missing|unable to verify payload type|400|{"message":"Please check API docs","status":"failure","reason":"unable to verify payload type"}|   > *Note* : * TPS around 100 provided multi-threading is implemented and utilize keepalive connections option in HTTP Client to minimize SSL overhead and latency. * End user incoming messages are received on callback shared by the the brand for the WhatsApp number. Response to those messages are sent using Session API. * Session works on rolling window concept which means brand's get 24 hour to reply back from the last incoming messages timestamp. * Timestamp shared on callback is in unix timestamp. * Buttons are of 2 types: Interactive List menu (max 10) and Quick reply button (max 3). * Interactive list menu button supports only text in header. * Quick reply button supports both text and multimedia in header.

Callback is configured against the WhatsApp Enterprise account for the clients to receive incoming messages and delivery reports.

> *Note* :
* End user incoming messages are received on callback shared by the the brand for the WhatsApp number. Response to those messages are sent using Session API.
* Session works on rolling window concept which means brand's get 24 hour to reply back from the last incoming messages timestamp.
* Timestamp shared on callback is in unix timestamp.

body.raw: {"contacts": [{"profile": {"name": "overw@tch"}, "wa_id": "917045273671"}], "messages": [{"context": {"from": "919321821011", "id": "gBEGkXBFJzZxAgmfF7hnuD9l0C0"}, "from": "917045273671", "id": "b398502a-eea8-11eb-ac2a-0242ac120007", "interactive": {"list_reply": {"description": "yummy flavour", "id": "rd133", "title": "Fish Masala"}, "type": "list_reply"}, "timestamp": "1627369389", "type": "interactive"}], "brand_msisdn": "919321821011", "request_id": "b398502a-eea8-11eb-ac2a-0242ac120007"}

{"contacts": [{"profile": {"name": "overw@tch"}, "wa_id": "917045273671"}], "messages": [{"context": {"from": "919321821011", "id": "gBEGkXBFJzZxAgnSloIc4jvENOo"}, "from": "917045273671", "id": "c5e396fe-eea8-11eb-9e4e-0242ac120007", "interactive": {"button_reply": {"id": "aaaa", "title": "Yes"}, "type": "button_reply"}, "timestamp": "1627369420", "type": "interactive"}]}

request.description:
To create Authorization token which is used in send message and Capability check APIs.

> *Note* :
* Validity of token is 1 hour.

Check WhatsApp enabled users via Capability check API.

> *Note* :
* Maximum 50 numbers are accepted in a request.
* Do send messages to the end users post checking the capability to avoid account deactivation.

## API details:   This API is used to trigger WhatsApp response to user initiated messages within 24 hour window.   ## API Request Details   |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|-----------------------|-------------------------| |`phone`|Mandatory|end user phone number with country code and +| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only for text response| |`peview_url`|Mandatory|Add only if you wish to see thumbnail of url added in text response| |`media`|Mandatory|Add only for multimedia response| |`extra`|Optional|Add only if you wish to pass any extra value in API and the same will be recieved in delivery reports|   ## `media` Field Breakdown:   media is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the multimedia or button sections of a session response:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`type`|Mandatory|Defines the multimedia shared| |`url`|Mandatory|Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia message| |`file`|Mandatory|Filename of the multimedia to be triggered| |`caption`|Mandatory|Text shared along with multimedia. Though it's mandatory still will not reflect for Audio| |`latitude`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`longitude`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`name`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`address`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending Location in session message| |`header`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message. This defines the text or multimedia shared in the button| |`body`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message. Defines the text descption at the top of the button options| |`footer_text`|Optional|Add only if you are sending button in session message. Add only if you want to show footer in button option| |`button`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending button in session message|   ## `header` Field Breakdown:   header is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys that define the button based header section of a session response:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`text`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending text in the header| |`type`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the button triggered| |`url`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Add publicly hosted url for all multimedia message| |`file`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the filename of the multimedia to be triggered| |`caption`|Mandatory|Add only if you are sending multimedia in the header. Defines the text shared along with multimedia. Though it's mandatory still will not reflect for Audio| ## `body` Field Breakdown:   body is a JSON string consisting of a text that defines the button options in session message:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`body`|Mandatory|Defines the text descption at the top of the button options| ## `button` Field Breakdown:   button is a JSON string consisting of a set of mandatory keys of the button options in session message:

  |*Key*|*Mandatory/Optional*|*Description*| |-----|--------------------|-------------| |`id`|Mandatory|Defines the position of the button| |`title`|Mandatory|Defines the button label. Max 20 charaters| |`description`|Optional|Add only if you want to describe more in regards to the interactive menu list button| |`section_title`|Mandatory|Add only if you have interactive menu list button. Describes the main list of the button| ## Success Response Structure: For every success request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and request_id.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Response Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|---------------|--------| |processing|message received successfully|Valid payload structure with unique request_id per request|202|{"message":"message received successfully","status":"processing","request_id":"794c3fd4-f142-11eb-8e02-0242ac120005"}​​​​|   ## Failed Response Structure: For every failed request, a JSON response is sent with key as status, message, and reason.
  |*Status*|*Message*|*Description*|*Reason*|*Error Code*|*Sample*| |--------|---------|-------------|--------|---------------|--------| |failed|unable to process request|Incorrect Authorization token|Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent|401|{"message":"unable to process request","status":"failed","reason":"Please check the integrity/validity of the token sent"}| |-|The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again.|Incorrect url|-|404|{"message": "The requested URL was not found on the server. If you entered the URL manually please check your spelling and try again."}| |-|The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand.|Incorrect payload structure|-|400|{"message":"The browser (or proxy) sent a request that this server could not understand."}| |failure|Please check API docs|Mandatory key is missing|unable to verify payload type|400|{"message":"Please check API docs","status":"failure","reason":"unable to verify payload type"}|   > *Note* : * TPS around 100 provided multi-threading is implemented and utilize keepalive connections option in HTTP Client to minimize SSL overhead and latency. * End user incoming messages are received on callback shared by the the brand for the WhatsApp number. Response to those messages are sent using Session API. * Session works on rolling window concept which means brand's get 24 hour to reply back from the last incoming messages timestamp. * Timestamp shared on callback is in unix timestamp. * Buttons are of 2 types: Interactive List menu (max 10) and Quick reply button (max 3). * Interactive list menu button supports only text in header. * Quick reply button supports both text and multimedia in header.
